projects.name: Project Authentication
projects.description: This project is a secure authentication system with a frontend and backend. The backend API includes user registration, sign-in, and an authenticated endpoint. The frontend has a registration form, a sign-in form, a page for authenticated content, and a 'sign out' button. User passwords are encrypted in the database, and user input is validated.

projects.name: Happy Thoughts API
projects.description: This project was about building an API using Express, MongoDB with GET request endpoints to return data and POST endpoints to create data. The project is also connected to a prior project.
projects.imageAlt: We like you too, written on brick wall.

projects.name: Mongo API
projects.description: In this project we have created our own RESTful API and then used Mongoose methods. This API was created using Express JS, MongoDB and Mongoose. The API uses data from a books API provided by Technigo, which is then broken down into endpoints selected by me.

projects.name: Express API
projects.description: This project is our first backend project in which we create an API using Express. The API were also supposed to get RESTful endpoints and return either an array of data or a single item.

projects.name: QR-code generator
projects.description: This project involved creating a custom-made hook and using it to build a QR code generator. This allows you to download the QR code as a PNG file.

projects.name: Design Hand-off
projects.description: A collaboration with UX designer Nathalie Gologan, who designed the project and provided a design hand-off at the start of the week, we embarked on creating a landing page for a pilates studio within 6 days. This project not only offred valuable experience in executing a predetermind design but also showcased the effectiveness of a streamlined hand-off process.

projects.name: Swede Quiz
projects.description: A quiz about Sweden using state management that ensures a smooth quiz experience for the user by rendering the questions, presenting the possible answers, and providing feedback on the user's selection.

projects.name: Movie Releases
projects.description: In this project I have been utilizing themoviedb.org's API to showcase movies and their details. Features fetching popular movies, rendering movie specifics, and managing image URLs. Designed with a focus on responsiveness and accessibility. Enhancements include error handling, loading states, and dynamic movie lists

projects.name: React Portfolio
projects.description: Welcome to my portfolio! This is a living project, constantly changing as it fits. In creating this portfolio, I got to further exercise the use of React hooks, components and props in React, as well as deep-diving into CSS, accessibility and following and implementing a Figma design to create a dynamic and interactive website.

projects.name: Happy Thoughts
projects.description: A React project focused on state management, API interactions for fetching and posting data. Features include a design-aligned UI, sorted thought display by recency, like count for each thought, a form for new thoughts, and a like functionality.

projects.name: Mushroom Survey
projects.description: A React project to create a mushroom survey form. Focus on React state and form control. After submission, users see a summary. Design is flexible but should prioritise accessibility.

projects.name: Music Releases
projects.description: A React app template to display albums. Features include a structured component hierarchy, design fidelity, hover effects, and responsive layouts. Clicking on albums or artists links to external URLs. Components provided; focus on data flow and UI interactions.

projects.name: Weather App
projects.description: A weather dashboard showcasing temperature, a 5-day forecast, city and current weather informaton as well as sunrrise and sunset of that specific city. Created using both mob-programming, pair-programming and branches.

projects.name: Guess Who Game
projects.description: A Guess Who-game. The user can select different properties and sort the game based on them. The goal is to figure out which character is the "secret".

projects.name: Soda chatbot
projects.description: A simple chatbot for the user to order soda, created using Javascript. Utilizing event-handlers, parameters, objects, etc.

projects.name: Javascript Pizzeria
projects.description: A simple pizza order application created with Javascript, to exercise the use of vaiables, conditionals etc.

projects.name: Utopia News
projects.description: This is my first project which is a fictive and responsive news site with only utopian news, created using HTML and CSS, Flexbox and Grid Layout.
